intro: Sisymbrium schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian mustard, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard species. The plant is characterized by its erect growth habit and pinnately compound leaves. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in the spring. Sisymbrium schimperi is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
